title: Fix incorrectly applied `Gravity` on Crouton view
message:
Fix incorrectly applied `Gravity` on Crouton view

- The Gravity attribute is currently applied on the TextView inside the contentView, a RelativeLayout. The TextView is the same height as the RelativeLayout, so it appears as though vertical Gravity settings (CENTER, CENTER_VERTICAL) aren't being applied correctly
- I changed it so that the RelativeLayout fills the croutonView, and also adds a layout rule based on the Gravity attribute. Now the RelativeLayout and FrameLayout are the same dimensions, but the TextView is full width, and wrap content for height, so it's able to use the RL rules for vertical positioning and as before with horizontal positioning.
- The fix only works with CENTER, CENTER_HORIZONTAL, and CENTER_VERTICAL; it hasn't been tested with RIGHT, LEFT etc.

title: included a proper uses-sdk tag
message:
included a proper uses-sdk tag

The value `android:minSdkVersion`, when inside the manifest tag, is invalid, but instead of generating errors, it will silently ignore the otherwise unknown property. Without uses-sdk, the project behaves as an SDK version 1 (Android 1.0) project.

title: Added ability to set the height to a dimension resource (so you can use density…
message: Added ability to set the height to a dimension resource (so you can use density independent pixels), added ability to set the padding in pixels or by using a dimension resource. Removed the ViewHolder class since it was unnecessary and was causing an Activity reference to be held in memory. The crouton now handles building the view when calling getView(). Added ability to use a completely custom view by calling Crouton.make(Activity, View).show() or Crouton.show(Activity, View) as a short cut.

title: Fixed issue where it was only creating the in and out animations once rather…
message: Fixed issue where it was only creating the in and out animations once rather than per crouton. Fixed bug where it wasn't allowing the previous crouton's animation to finish before showing a new crouton (old one would just disappear). Fixed bug in Manager.clearCroutonQueue() where it wasn't removing the croutons from the screen. If there was a crouton showing and the clearCroutonQueue() method was called it would leave that one showing indefinitely. Added a method to clear all croutons for the provided activity. It will remove the crouton from the activity content view and any pending messages. Implemented the cancel() method in Crouton. The cancel() method will remove the crouton from the activity's content view immediately and remove any pending messages.

title: Added a Builder class to build Crouton Styles. Also added the ability to set the…
message: Added a Builder class to build Crouton Styles. Also added the ability to set the text size, text appearance, a shadow color, radius, horizontal and vertical offset, in animation and out animation. Fixed bug where the text was not being centered in the view. Removed unnecessary ImageView that was being used as the background, in favor of just setting the background on the view.
